TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintDocumentImageableArea extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies the size of the paper (or other media), the size of the imageable area, and the location of the imageable area.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Most laser and inkjet printers do not support borderless printing. They must leave an unprinted area around the edges of the paper to prevent toner from getting on the parts of the printer that move the paper. For printers that do not support borderless printing, the imageable area of the paper is smaller than the paper dimensions.
Use <xref:System.Printing.PrintDocumentImageableArea> objects primarily as parameters to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> methods.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ExtentHeight As Double
public: property double ExtentHeight { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the height of the imageable area.
Docs.value: A that represents the distance from the origin.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Printing.PrintDocumentImageableArea.ExtentHeight%2A> property gets the distance from the upper-left corner of the imageable area (also called the 'origin' of the imageable area) to the lower-left corner of the imageable area.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ExtentWidth As Double
public: property double ExtentWidth { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the width of the imageable area.
Docs.value: A that represents the distance from the origin.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Printing.PrintDocumentImageableArea.ExtentWidth%2A> property gets the distance from the upper-left corner of the imageable area (also called the 'origin' of the imageable area) to the upper-right corner of the imageable area.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MediaSizeHeight As Double
public: property double MediaSizeHeight { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the height of the paper or media.
Docs.value: A that represents the distance from the upper-left corner of the page to the lower-left corner.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MediaSizeWidth As Double
public: property double MediaSizeWidth { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the width of the paper or media.
Docs.value: A that represents the distance from the upper-left corner of the page to the upper-right corner.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OriginHeight As Double
public: property double OriginHeight { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the upper-left corner of the imageable area (also called the 'origin' of the imageable area) to the nearest point on the top edge of the page.
Docs.value: A that represents the distance (in pixels - 1/96 of an inch) from the upper-left corner of the imageable area (also called the 'origin' of the imageable area) to the nearest point on the top edge of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OriginWidth As Double
public: property double OriginWidth { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the origin width, which is the distance from the left edge of the page to the upper-left corner of the imageable area (also called the "origin" of the imageable area).
Docs.value: A that represents the origin width (in pixels - 1/96 of an inch), which is the distance from the left edge of the page to the upper-left corner of the imageable area (also called the "origin" of the imageable area).
